content:
• Wednesday, December 28, 2016
  • BGCP

    BGC Partners updates Q4 guidance

    • Brokerage company BGC Partners (BGCP -2.1%) issued an update to its outlook for the fourth quarter.
    • The company now sees revenues around the midpoint of previous guidance, and for pretax distributable earnings to sit in the high end of its range.
    • With third-quarter earnings, the company had guided to Q4 revenues of $630M-$675M, and for pretax distributable earnings to increase between 3 and 21% (in the range of $107M-$125M).
    • BGC will issue a release regarding the availability of its results by 8 a.m. ET Feb. 9.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 PM | 6 Comments
  • NRZ

    New Residential inks MSR purchase deal with PHH Corp.

    • New Residential (NYSE:NRZ) agrees to buy about $72B UPB of seasoned agency and private-label MBS from PHH Corp. (NYSE:PHH) for roughly $612M. Alongside, NRZ will buy about $300M of servicer advances from PHH.
    • Also part of the deal, PHH will subservice the mortgages (480K of them) underlying the purchased MSRs for an initial period of three years.
    • The deal is expected to close in H1.
    • For PHH's part, it sold the MSRs for about 84 basis points of the UPB, and the $912M in proceeds will be used to pay down debt. The deal rids PHH of its remaining MSR portfolio. The company continues to study strategic options, and expects to have something to present to investors by the end of January.
    • NRZ +0.4%, PHH +1.5% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM | 27 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

  • FBIO

    Fortress Biotech +32% after hours; MB-101 case study forthcoming, complete remission in patient with recurrent glioblastoma cited

    • Case study from phase 1 clinical trial of MB-101 (IL13Rα2-specific, Chimeric Antigen Receptor engineered CAR T cells [CAR T cells]) for the treatment of glioblastoma [GBM] to be distributed in December 29 edition of the New England Journal of Medicine.
    • MB-101 is a lead development candidate of Fortress Biotech (NASDAQ:FBIO) company, Mustang Bio.
    • Shares to $3.03 after closing out at $2.29.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM | 4 Comments

  • PXD

    Loosening credit has shale drillers set to expand investment

    • Shale drillers are set to increase budgets next year, with a little help from their banks.
    • An oil price recovery is prompting lenders to extend credit lines for the first time in two years. And even a small increase (Reuters estimates an average of 5%) has a number of producers including Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD -1.8%), Diamondback Energy (FANG -0.9%) and RSP Permian (RSPP -1.3%) boosting expenditure forecasts for the coming year.
    • Raymond James expects oil and gas producers with a North American focus to increase capital investment by 30% in 2017.
    • "The 'animal spirits' seem to be coming back to the exploration and production market, albeit slowly," said analyst Kyle Owusu after the past three industry reviews saw available credit cut by 40%.
    • While some companies are seeing big expansions in their borrowing base -- Rice Energy's (RICE -0.6%) was boosted to $1.45B from $1B after it bought Vantage Energy -- others go a different route (Carrizo (CRZO -3.1%) has kept its credit line steady at $600M and sold $225M in stock to fund land buys).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPRI

    Michael Kors, Coach rise intraday amid reports Kate Spade exploring sale

    • Since just prior to an initial volatility halt placed on Kate Spade trade at 12:33 PM ET, Michael Kors (KORS) and Coach (COH) are both up roughly 2.6% to respective $43.24 and $35.09 levels.
    • Investors are responding actively across the names on reports Kate Spade is exploring a sale, with that company's shares now at nearly 25% gains on the session.
    • Earlier: Kate Spade +15.85%, sale exploration reported [updated]
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM

  • KYO-OLD

    AVX -4.15%, Kyocera notifies of intent to market products independently

    • Effective January 1, 2018, Kyocera (NYSE:KYO-OLD), holder of 72% of AVX's (NYSE:AVX) outstanding shares, plans to market manufactured products worldwide using its own sales force instead of through AVX reselling in the Americas, Europe and Asia.
    • Kyocera resale products are recorded at $261.8M in revenue and $16.7M in related operating profit for the FY 2016 term ended March 31, 2016.
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM

  • KATE

    Kate Spade +15.85%, sale exploration reported [updated]

    • Developing.
    • Shares (NYSE:KATE) had been halted for volatility and subsequently resumed as of 12:39 PM ET.
    • Update (12:50 PM ET): Trading halt reinstated at 12:42 PM ET, also on volatility, and again resumed at 12:48PM ET with shares active 18%+ higher.
    • Update (1:00 PM ET): Reportedly under pressure from activist shareholder Caerus Investors, early stage work with a bank and contact with prospective buyers, inclusive of other retailers, is suggested.

    H.C. Wainwright & Co. starts Ocera Therapeutics at Buy, $10 target

    • Analyst Ed Arce highlights Ocera Therapeutics lead drug OCR-002, suggesting its "potential to become the gold standard" among hepatic encephalopathy therapies.

  • BK

    Bank of New York Mellon upgraded to Strong Buy at Raymond James

    • Analyst David Long moves a level up from Outperform and raises target from $50 to $57, citing recent underperformance, overblown prospective market headwinds and what he believes to be an appealing entry point.
    • Further sees benefits from steeper yield curve, recent federal funds rate hike, heightened volume and volatility within capital markets (FX trading, securities lending), higher equity market valuations and positive long-term indicators among worldwide custody/servicing segment.
    • Bank of New York Mellon (NYSE:BK) +1.11% to $48.26.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • NVDA

    Citron Research cautious on Nvidia, projects return to $90

    • Suggesting market disregard for headwinds, Citron Research notes Nvidia growth primarily stemming from gaming at the expense of Advanced Micro Devices, and not through new total addressable markets, presence of major data center competition from legacy and newcomer players [Intel Xeon Phi, AMD Radeon Pro and new desktop and server GPUs to come in 2017, Xilinx], access of Nvidia intellectual property Intel already maintains through a licensing deal set to end this year, impact attrition of Intel licensing revenue will have on 2017 EBITDA, impact increasing Intel competition will have on gross margins and competition from existing customers [Google's TPU, Apple].
    • Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) -2.94%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 36 Comments
  • LIVE

    Live Ventures +29% after wrapping record year

    • Live Ventures (NASDAQ:LIVE) is up 29.6% premarket after posting record earnings and wrapping what it said was the most successful year in its history.
    • It noted a record $79M in revenues for the year (up 136%) and net profit of about $17.82M -- about $8.92 per share.
    • That's largely attributable to net operating losses it built up before becoming a diversified holding company.
    • Stockholders' equity rose 192% Y/Y, the company says, and present management points to its CAGR on that measure of 100.58% since it took over five years ago.
    • In 2017 guidance, the company expects "multiple" factors to have an impact. Revenues should increase by "well over 50%, easily surpassing $120M," and stockholders' equity to grow in high double digits.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 13 Comments
  • BCEI

    Bonanza Creek Energy resumes decline after bankruptcy news

    • After a relief move up yesterday, Bonanza Creek Energy (NYSE:BCEI) -- which tumbled 58% Friday on news it would file for bankruptcy -- is off another 19% premarket today.
    • The Denver-based company said it planned to eliminate $850M in debt and provide $200M in new equity with a Chapter 11 restructuring. It expects to file by Jan. 5 and exit bankruptcy protection in the first quarter.
    • Bankruptcy filings for oil and gas producers more than doubled this year vs. last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 9 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: GALE +28%. LIVE +27%. MICT +24%. OCRX +18%. SINO +12%. ACHN +6%.
    • Losers: OTC:ANTH -63%. BCEI -17%. NAK -5%.

  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma +25% as blood cancer therapy advances

    • Galena Biopharma (GALE) is up 25% premarket after confirming a regulatory pathway for a new drug application for its GALE-401 blood cancer therapy.
    • After a "productive" meeting with the FDA, the company believes a pivotal phase 3 trial is appropriate to move GALE-401 (Anagrelide controlled release) through the 505(b)(2) path.
    • The company expects to initiate the trial, which will enroll patients with essential thrombocythemia who have either failed or are intolerant to hydroxyurea, in the second quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM | 24 Comments
  • GLBL

    Knighthead takes stake in Terraform Global

    • Terraform Global (NASDAQ:GLBL) rose 2.5% in extended trading on Tuesday after Knighthead Capital disclosed a 6.4% stake in the alternative energy company.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM | 95 Comments
  • TOSYY

    Toshiba shares down 20%, hit daily limit

    • Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSYY) shares tumbled 20% overnight, hitting the Tokyo exchange's daily downward limit, after the company said it could face a multi-billion dollar charge on the nuclear power unit it acquired last year from CB&I (NYSE:CBI).
    • Addressing reporters late on Tuesday, Toshiba executives declined to provide further details about the writedown, adding that the sum would be finalized by mid-February.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 AM | 8 Comments
